Reviews.Author: felix mendez BIZGLOBAL
Reviews.Content: excellent phone. is very fast, the long battery life. fully released to cualquieroperadora. very very happy with this high-end cell

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: silver
Reviews.Content: IT is pure 4.2 android.camera you need to take your time with, but it will take good photos. videos are excellent. best part the processor is fast.my con is moving apps to the SD. the ROM (storage) and memory could be better.overall I am very happy with this phone and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great device - some suggestions for
Reviews.Author: Christopher Muro
Reviews.Content: So much to love about this phone, so much that I bought another one for myself on Black Friday.  I bought this for my wife for the upcoming international trip, thus the D310i model for international frequencies.  I don't have a SIM in it yet, but will have one soon in Iceland to test.I have some tech suggestions for the product though.  As everyone mentions, it has a very small amount of RAM.  This isn't as noticeable as you'd might think.  The phone is still VERY responsive and snappy.  The memory is managed well and swapped without notice.  So that is wish item #1, more RAM.  How much would an extra 512mb RAM add to the production cost of this model.The second item on my wish list would be the ability to use the phone as a wi-fi hot spot, WITHOUT losing the wi-fi connection.  So this would require two channels or antennae?  I know my laptop can do this, connect to a wi-fi source and then start it's own hot spot to share it.  I'd love this device to do that as well.The third wish item would be for 3G/4G LTE compatibility.  We are mainly data users and not cell talkers, so most of the time the cell will be chucking data back and forth and not handling an actual voice call.  It'd be great to handle that quicker than as GSM speeds.  We always fall back to wi-fi when available.We have been using the phones as SIP phones in the mean time and they are great.  They work on all wi-fi here, panera, mcds, local laundrymat, on the bus with wi-fi.  The ear piece volume is very clear and loud, even on the lowest setting.  The included mic/earphones work great as well.  Overall I am very impressed.I hope they keep developing this product and continue to release updates so the phone can grow with our usage.  It would be great to see kitkat on this device.Great customer support, reached out to us after our purchase to confirm everything was ok.  I'd recommend they keep doing that, as not many businesses have pro-active customer service and I like it.  We didn't call them or need to, although the exact model bought elsewhere (the second one I ordered for myself) came with an awesome shell/case, which I gave to my wife (who drops things).  Not sure if they were both supposed to come with the shell or not, the one shipped from Amazon didn't have it and the other directly from their company HQ in Florida did.  I don't use a shell, so we didn't bother with it.  The shell is great, and if you want the shell, confirm that it comes with it.  Also they come with a screen protector if you want to use that as well.I turn off wi-fi and other services (airplane) when charging - it charges faster and quickly.  I have been turning off wi-fi when sleeping and shushing the ringer and the phone lasts easily 90+ hours between charges.  I use battery doctor pro to track and 3 cycle charging.  I have been unplugged for 27 hours and I have 74% battery remaining.Overall this is a great product from a company nobody has heard of.  I used gsmarena to compare models and features before settling on the Dash 4.5.  I like the upgrades offered in the other models, but wasn't willing to pay for them.  This phone hit my price point for the features.It would be great if more xda-developers had this device available to them for modding.If anyone has questions, feel free to respond and I will try to answer them.  This is a great device.

Reviews.Title: Mixed review.
Reviews.Author: Trell "Reader, gamer (paper, board & eGames)"
Reviews.Content: I'm new to the Smart phone world, so I'm still learning what the phone does vs what "Android smartphones should do".- This was the best-featured phone (running android 4+ was key) I found in an more-than-casual search. It would have been nice to find a version that didn't have the 2nd Sim spot. Never going to use that.-I'm using this with Consumer Cellular. This phone wasn't on their list, but they do "any unlocked (GSM/ used for ATT ) phone". (it's really using ATT Cingular)-I don't have an SD card in, yet.-touch response is great.-Came with wired earbuds/mike (you need the wire for the FM Radio).-Sound is good with or without earbuds-Works fine for phone, texting.-Bluetooth worked fine-a lot better than the tracfone I was moving stuff off of.-Wifi works fine in some areas, but I think it isn't 'backwards compatible-I can't log onto my 6+ year old home network.-Data (non-wifi) connections are dicey, When it does connect, it works 'somewhat'-so far the ap I'm testing it with, the stock navigation Ap the phone came with- crashes after a few turns. Again, don't know if that's the phone, the plan (disclaimer: if you don't use their phones, Web might not work), or just "New England's coverage".-The manual was pointless, little more than a list of features, with no substance. To get the SIm chip in, I had to go  to youtube.-According to my 20-something spawn & his friends, random crashes of any Ap-returning it to the home screen without any message or warning-is a feature of Android-. Perhaps to make Windows users more comfortable?-Expect to charge it nightly, if you use the wifi all day long. I was in the hospital reading/playing on-phone games/surfiing for about 6 hours, and it was dead by nightfall.-Email support was prompt, if vague. I downloaded an ap that displays what sensors it has-and it shows there's a compass (magnetic sensor). I wrote to Blu's TS, mentioning a problem with the compass (Google Sky), they sent me back a screenshot of the same ap (I hadn't mentioned it), showing it had no compass.

Reviews.Title: Like it, but I'm old school
Reviews.Author: BajaInsider
Reviews.Content: I needed a new phone and this was in the price category I needed. Works great on Telcel here in Baja California Sur, Mx. Some of the menu features are drawn out with confirmations ie "yes, delete the darn thing, yes I really mean it" and the wireless seems to have very limited range. The real reason I bought it was to show clients how their websites looked 'mobile' I also bought a cheap tablet. I'm old school though, I don't use it as a note pad and my big fingers have trouble hitting the right keys.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Commuter
Reviews.Content: The camera is terribly choppy, the shutter is terribly slow, and the wifi signal drops out like crazy (even with strong signal).

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected...
Reviews.Author: Joe Larabell
Reviews.Content: Used this phone in the US and in Japan with various SIM chips and it worked as expected. Runs cooler and with longer battery life than most Android phones. Touch screen seems very responsive. Dual-SIM functionality was both simple and reliable. Worked fine with Google Play. Not much bloatware installed by default. A surprisingly solid phone for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: My review is based on using it overseas. I have not used the cell phone capabilities in the U.S. I specifically bought this to use in Spain. It works great. I was able to buy a SIM card at the Orange store in Madrid. Within 2 minutes I had cell phone and email/internet. Screen is clear. Sound quality is good. I would buy another BLU product if needed.

Reviews.Title: OK for price
Reviews.Author: UpstateSC
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to 'android' stuff.  Getting the back cover off to install sim cards, memory card, and battery is frustrating, difficult, and you will assume you are destroying the phone, and may be right.One of the little 'push' button things on the case cover fell off during one of my removal/attachment sessions, and it was not easy to get in back in position.The phone is OK, and probably good for the price.  I needed an Android phone for some apps related to my job that are not available for my blackberry.  (Wake up, BLACKBERRY!)The dash 4.5 has an adequate operating system and camera to run the check deposit program for my credit union, and also the transflo now app.  (for submitting trucker related paperwork)I doubt I'll use this much as a phone, since I prefer my blackberry, but this is a good backup that runs the office apps I need, and can do so via wifi.  (don't need a sim card all the time)  I may use this as a 'travel' phone overseas, and the sim card from my tmobile bberry will work in this.

Reviews.Title: A good fit
Reviews.Author: charles
Reviews.Content: Pros: Dual unlocked phone with two sims. Delivers on its data promise of H+ on the Straight Talk or ATT network. I got up 14.mps. This D310i works best on those 2 networks. Check you carrier's network bands first--- the other version works better on T^-Mobile. I got 7.7 mps on T-Mobile. Screen appears ok.Cons: You cannot move you programs/Apps  to the sd card like like most Android products. You can store pictures, music etc. but you cannot move programs. You are limited to phone internal storage, Thus I have to clean out the cache to get extra space. Cover is hard to remove.So/So: Battery life on wi/fi only.

Reviews.Title: Was skeptical but...
Reviews.Author: Malia Galinato
Reviews.Content: I love this phone.. it has done nothing but amaze me.  Yes it has crashed a few times, and I needed to do a battery pull a couple times but other than that this phone is awesome.  And lets just say you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: Blu Dash 4.5
Reviews.Author: Very Pleased
Reviews.Content: The price might be cheap but the quality is on par with the best. Excellent quality. Works better than advertised. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice Android phone especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: cerx
Reviews.Content: I got this phone while waiting for ATT to unlock my iPhone 5 after switching to T-Mobile.As far as speed is concerned it compares well with a 4s or 5 iPhone. Not surprising it's not as well made as an iPhone and does not have smudge-resistant gorilla glass screen, but it is by no means flimsy and with the rubber backing it rests well in the hand.Manual is rather useless and, as others stated, it does not even give the perhaps most important information and that is how to open it to insert battery and SIM card(s).But overall it deserves a recommendation!

Reviews.Title: Had to return it
Reviews.Author: Peggy G.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I had to send it back. It kept shutting down on me and the only way it would turn back on was to remove the battery and reinstall it.  Evidently it was defective.  I am considering trying again, but have not reordered yet.

Reviews.Title: Value for money.
Reviews.Author: Kelly McKean
Reviews.Content: Great phone for the price.  This phone does everything advertised, with a 32gb SD card it has all the storage I need.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, Decent phone.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Cheap and easy to set up.  Make sure you pay close attention to the frequencies though.  If you are in the us the D310A might be a better choice!  Also, this dropped and the screen cracked, so you will want to see if you can find a case for it.

Reviews.Title: Cheap. Could be great, but... Needs more RAM and work on OS config.
Reviews.Author: DV
Reviews.Content: Could be a great phone for a great price.Would be 5 stars if it had more RAM, an android 4.3 update (from 4.2.1) and didn't kill apps on a whim.I would gladly add money for more RAM and a better OS configuration.Key pointersThe cons:1. Can't multi-task e.g. when you switch between GPS app and phone app (make/answer a call), GPS app shuts down or if you try to call a number from a website, then try to return to the site to get the end of the number (no option to call on long click) then you have to reload site and reenter any user input you need to get to that page.This is probably due to the system app MTK Thermal Manager, but I can't uninstall it to check since the phone isn't rooted. Also, if the limitation was just the RAM, then memory paging would do the trick.2. The browsers (built in browser, Chrome and Firefox) both crash often, I assume this is due to RAM limitation, since even when I don't have anything but the system running I am left with only 40MB-60MB RAM available. Other apps (Waze, keyboard!) also crash often too.3. Exchange sync misses meetings, I assume this is due to older Android version.4. It is really hard to get the back cover off (to install battery, SIM and SD card).The pros:1. Call quality is great.2. Camera quality is great.3. Price.4. Potentially dual SIM feature, although I haven't tested this yet.Update:I discovered the developer options (settings --> About phone --> click on build number (last item) multiple times) and tried increasing the number of background apps but that didn't help.Update 2:Turning on and off didn't fix RAM/crashes, however, taking the battery out and putting it back in again frees up 10s of MBs, so the problems must be due to a memory leak + soft off button not working as hard off.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone, Minor Issues
Reviews.Author: chirs combs
Reviews.Content: The phone overall works great for the money. The battery lasts about two whole days of use on a full charge. The phone doesn't run too well with a lot of apps open, but you just have to limit yourself on how many apps you run at one time.The big issue for me is the headphone jack. The headphones the phone comes with are cheap, but they work. Although, if you try to use say apple iPod headphones they don't work at all. It's almost as if the headphone jack has to be just a bit longer.\ALSO, This phone may be unlocked but you must read this:I am using this phone through NET 10. With NET 10 you can place this phone on the AT&T; network or the T-Mobile network. The T-Mobile network does not support the band of this phone, however AT&T; does. I encountered the problem because T-Mobile placed the phone on a 1G network, however once the phone was switched to AT&T; I did receive 3G HSPA+.Overall great phone for the price!

Reviews.Title: As usual, manual not up to the quality of the phone.
Reviews.Author: F. Kimper
Reviews.Content: Terrific phone.  Wish the manual was better.  Technical service answers questions quickly and courteously, but it would be nice to have a better manual.

Reviews.Title: Blu dash 4.5
Reviews.Author: Johanny Medina
Reviews.Content: Excellent product! arrived very fast and i'm completely satisfied.Nice camera, nice performance, great size and unlocked for all operators. High quality for low price!

Reviews.Title: Sim problem
Reviews.Author: Charles S. France
Reviews.Content: Tried using two SIM cards in this phone, however only one worked. My best bet is that the phone has some sort of problem.

Reviews.Title: great product great price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "effy@effy.com"
Reviews.Content: obviously would be better for $99 especially since the Nexus 4 is selling for $199.  I bought the i model to use in Europe and Asia with 3G and it is great
